explanation:
To determine whether digest_calc_hash violates the MISRA rule forbidding direct or indirect self-calls, you must examine the full transitive call chain starting at digest_calc_hash. The listed symbols are all functions (and intrinsic helpers) that digest_calc_hash directly calls (the three finish functions) or that those finish functions call according to the static call graph. Each entry is required because any of them could (directly or indirectly) call back into digest_calc_hash and thus create forbidden recursion: 

- MHD_MD5_finish: direct callee of digest_calc_hash; its body must be inspected for any path back to digest_calc_hash. 
- md5_transform: callee of MHD_MD5_finish; included to check further call chain. 
- _MHD_PUT_64BIT_LE_SAFE: callee of MHD_MD5_finish; included to verify it does not call back. 
- MHD_SHA256_finish: direct callee of digest_calc_hash; its body must be inspected for any path back to digest_calc_hash. 
- sha256_transform: callee of MHD_SHA256_finish; included to check further call chain. 
- _MHD_PUT_64BIT_BE_SAFE: callee of MHD_SHA256_finish; included to verify it does not call back. 
- __builtin_bswap32: intrinsic used by MHD_SHA256_finish; included for completeness (intrinsics normally do not call user functions). 
- MHD_SHA512_256_finish: direct callee of digest_calc_hash; its body must be inspected for any path back to digest_calc_hash. 
- sha512_256_transform: callee of MHD_SHA512_256_finish; included to check further call chain. 
- __builtin_bswap64: intrinsic used by MHD_SHA512_256_finish; included for completeness.

No other symbols are required because the static call graph shows no further callees beyond these for the finish functions; examining these will establish whether any path from digest_calc_hash can return to itself (i.e., form indirect recursion).
